author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> The consensus version header / fork digest tells you the SSZ type for the light client object. It is always derived from attested_header.beacon.slot

The finalized_header.beacon.slot tells you what fork to use to compute the historical hash_tree_root.

There are teste in consensus-spec-tests specifically around fork boundaries, would recommend looking into them.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> When creating LC data, the historical header is migrated to the fork that matches the object fork.

When processing the LC data, need to convert it back to its original fork to validate hash_tree_root based on slot.

EIP-7688 StableContainer can resolve this, as it ensures that hash_tree_root computation becomes stable across forks. Feel free to comment on it :-)
